alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 11:57AM EST until January 14 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1245 PM EST. * At 1154 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Cochranville to Rock Springs, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Kennett Square and Nottingham Locations impacted include... Kennett Square, Oxford, West Grove, Homeville, Glen Roy, Mount Vernon, Cochranville, Kemblesville, Landenberg, Avondale, and Toughkenamon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
